channel.title: topics on PHI 182a
channel.description: Recent content in topics on PHI 182a

item.title: Topic N: Epicureans
item.description: Reading Epicurus, “The Principal Doctrines,” in The Epicurus Reader pages 32–36. Epicurus, “Letter to Herodotus,” in The Epicurus Reader pages 5 ff. Epicurus, “Letter to Menoeceus,” in The Epicurus Reader pages 28–31. See also David Konstan, “Epicurus” in the SEP Catherine Wilson, “How to be an Epicurean” in Aeon magazine, 2019

item.title: Topic 1: Socrates
item.description: Reading (This section lists required readings and where to find them. For due dates, see the schedule page.) Plato, Apology, first part. Translated by GMA Grube, in Five Dialogues 2nd ed., pages 21–28. Or, see the PDF under Course Documents on Blackboard for a stopgap measure while you’re acquiring the books. Plato, Crito, translated by GMA Grube, in Five Dialogues 2nd ed. (12 pages total) Plato, Hippias Major in Socrates and the Sophists, tr.
